required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Myocarditis Causing Premature Ventricular Contractions:Insights From the MAVERIC Registry
clinical_study.official_title: Myocarditis Causing Premature Ventricular Contractions:Insights From the MAVERIC Registry

lead_sponsor.agency: Kansas City Heart Rhythm Research Foundation

clinical_study.source: Kansas City Heart Rhythm Research Foundation

brief_summary.textblock: To assess potential link between unrecognized myocardial inflammation (myocarditis) and premature ventricular contractions (PVCs) associated with and without reduced LVEF through comprehensive diagnostic work up.

detailed_description.textblock: Hypothesized that occult inflammation is clinically under-recognized in patients with symptomatic PVCs with and without LV dysfunction and can be a potential link between the 2 conditions. Aimed to evaluate the incidence of underlying inflammation using the PET scan in patients presenting with symptomatic PVCs enrolled retrospectively in the MAVERIC registry.

primary_outcome.measure: Identify the underlying myocarditis in patients presenting with PVCs with or without reduced LVEF
primary_outcome.description: To identify the underlying myocarditis in patients presenting with PVCs with or without reduced LVEF through laboratory testing, FDG-PET scan, Cardiac Magnetic Resonance imaging and/or Endomyocardial biopsy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ascertain whether immunosuppressive therapy (IST) affords short term and long term improvement of LVEF and clinical outcomes
secondary_outcome.description: To ascertain whether immunosuppressive therapy (IST) affords short term and long term improvement of LVEF and clinical outcomes in virus negative and FDG-PET positive patients with non-ischemic cardiomyopathy, myocardial inflammation and PVCs.

other_outcome.measure: Evaluate whether IST + cathether ablation results in optimal clinical response
other_outcome.description: To evaluate whether IST + cathether ablation results in optimal clinical response in virus negative and FDG-PET positive patients with PVCs with or without reduced LVEF

study_pop.textblock: Males and females with PVC and ventricular tachycardia (VT) will be enrolled if they meet the inclusion/exclusion criteria

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients > 18 years of age with mono-morphic or polymorphic PVC burden of ≥5000 in 24 hours.
- Non-sustained VT was defined as ≥3 more consecutive beats lasting <30 seconds
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of myocardial infarction,
- Significant flow-limiting coronary artery disease (≥50% stenosis) on invasive coronary angiography or CT angiography,
- History of revascularization,
- Significant symptomatic atrial arrhythmias associated with LV dysfunction,
- Severe valvular disease,
- Cardiomyopathy attributed to toxins such as alcohol and illicit drugs,
- History of cardiac arrest,
- History of channelopathies or inherited arrhythmias.
